intro: Cynanchum gentryi, commonly known as Gentry's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its deep root system. Its leaves are usually narrow and opposite, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
